titleStmt.title: To CHARLES KENT,William Charles Mark Kent (always known as Charles) (1823-1902; Dictionary of National Biography), poet, miscellaneous writer and journalist; eldest son of William Kent, RN, and nephew of Bishop Charles Baggs, Catholic Vicar-Apostolic of West England; a strict Roman Catholic. Educated at Prior Park, Bath, and St Mary's College, Oscott. Editor of the Sun 1845-70 (proprietor 1850) and frequent contributor to Household Words. CD initially corresponded with Kent from 1848, in the latter's role as editor (see Pilgrim Letters 5, p. 294); they later became good friends. Kent was the author of Charles Dickens as a Reader (London: Chapman & Hall, 1872). [EARLY-MID 1860s]
